sections.content: Welcome to the wonderful world of JavaScript! This lesson module will take you on an adventure through JavaScript's core concepts with a fun, engaging approach. By the end of this module, you'll understand what makes JavaScript tick and be ready to start coding your own interactive web experiences.
JavaScript is the playful spirit of the web! While HTML provides structure and CSS handles style, JavaScript brings websites to life with:

items: Interactivity: Respond to user clicks, typing, and other actions
Dynamic content: Change webpage content on the fly
Animated effects: Create movement and visual flair
Data processing: Handle information without reloading the page

sections.content: JavaScript was famously created in just 10 days in May 1995 by Brendan Eich while he was working at Netscape. Originally named "Mocha," then briefly "LiveScript," it was finally renamed "JavaScript" as a marketing move to capitalize on the popularity of Java (though the two languages are quite different!).

sections.content: After mastering these fundamentals, you can explore:

items: Asynchronous JavaScript: Promises, async/await, fetching data
Modern JS Frameworks: React, Vue, Angular
Create a variable to store your name
Write a function that takes your name and returns a personalized greeting
Use an if statement to check if your name has more than 5 characters
Create a simple loop that counts from 1 to your name's length
JavaScript has nothing to do with Java! The similar name was purely for marketing purposes.
Despite being created in just 10 days, JavaScript has become one of the most popular programming languages in the world.
The official name of JavaScript is actually ECMAScript (ES).
JavaScript can run not just in browsers, but also on servers, in databases, and even on IoT devices.
The first JavaScript engine was created in 10 days, but modern JavaScript engines like V8 (used in Chrome and Node.js) are incredibly sophisticated and fast.
